Totally surprised by this game.  I wasnt going to bother with it, but wow, am I glad I did.It just gets better and better as it goes on. You actually feel part of something much bigger.There are few games that I would say felt epic (maybe Uncharted 4?), but this delivered in spades.100% recommended.

This an amazing game. I am glad I canceled my COD preorder and picked this up instead. Single played story was fun and amazing. The MP is solid and fun as hell. Just a superb game and a homerun for the devs. More people need to try it! It's in my top 3 for this year, for sure.

Titanfall 2 is one of the newer shooters out this year. The game shows off anew style of game with the involvement of mech's known as Titans. The first Titanfall was praised of being something fresh and new with the other shooters being more grounded and predictable in its gameplay. The problem with the first Titanfall was that it only featured Multiplayer with very few content that wasn'tTitanfall 2 is one of the newer shooters out this year. The game shows off anew style of game with the involvement of mech's known as Titans. The first Titanfall was praised of being something fresh and new with the other shooters being more grounded and predictable in its gameplay. The problem with the first Titanfall was that it only featured Multiplayer with very few content that wasn't enough to make it 60 dollars worth and with the lifespan of only lasting a few months, it was very surprising to see that the game got a sequel. So does it measure up to even better than its predecessor or does it fall flat under with the other grounded shooters?Developers Respawn Entertainment as gotten a lot of backlash with the consumers about not having enough in the first Titanfall and one of them was that the game lacked a campaign mode. They have now addressed that and have added a campaign in Titanfall 2. From what I have played, the campaign is very good if not being very cliche on its story. I played as a Pilot name Jack Cooper whose job is to stop an evil cooperation from developing a weapon that can destroy planets. It sounds really basic with the good vs evil kind of thing, but what makes the campaign story fun to play through was the companion I got at the beginning. The companion was named BT-7274 or BT for short. He is a Titan that is linked to Jack  Cooper in which gave a battle advantage in a lot of scenarios. Throughout the campaign, the relationship between BT and Jack was written out well with given dialogue between the two and funny skits that was amusing which gave character to mechanical titan as he gives unusual literally responses that doesn't help the given situation or him trying to give Jack a thumbs up.Given that, the gameplay of the game is astonishing. The game is a shooter but the spin of the whole game is that the player is given to free maneuver around. To jumping over 40 ft in the air from running on walls as the player is shooting at Titans or pilots, the game is endless on its scenarios. From my playthrough, I was able to use a variety of weapons from Sub-machine guns to Auto-Pistols with the given setting of the world as each gun sound is impacting and astounding to listen to. The sound of the game is very well done as Titans clash against each other with the metals grazing or when a Titan punches on a Pilot, the pilot just burst into red mist.The only problem I had with the game was that even though the campaign was really refreshing to play, the story was too predictable and tameness as nothing in the story was climatic, given the amazing set pieces of the game. The villain's in the weren't fleshed out as well with one popping up after another. I don't really even know their end game since the ones I fought were mercenaries for hire. I wished the story was given more thought and the world was told better to help the player be more involved in the world.The game has a few flaws that would've made it even better but I am very happy of what I got. Titanfall 2 is an outstanding game with newly fresh gameplay and beautiful scenery. I say that it is a buy for anyone who wants a shooter or something different from the usual modern warfare.\

It\s a nice 8.5/10 game not worth the \could be the FPS of the year\ **** found in most reviews.Do yourself a favor and play the single player Doom campaign first. It\s amazing.As for the multiplayer? For me it\s just another Call of Duty. This means it\s great, but in no way truly different from what we all know (and mostly love). I was very disappointed.The game starts on a highIt\s a nice 8.5/10 game not worth the \could be the FPS of the year\ **** found in most reviews.Do yourself a favor and play the single player Doom campaign first. It\s amazing.As for the multiplayer? For me it\s just another Call of Duty. This means it\s great, but in no way truly different from what we all know (and mostly love). I was very disappointed.The game starts on a high note. Visually stunning and in fluid 60 frames per second. The first level is absolutely gorgeous. My first (not very technical) impression was: \holy **** they outdid Uncharted 4 and in 60fps! Why would I buy the PS4 PRO? How much better can it get?\. Yes, it\s that good.That is all the praise this game is going to get from me though.The graphics are so amazing that for the first hour or so you don\t notice how boring the gameplay is. It\s only when the visual splendor drops drastically (to recover at the final part of the game for a short while) that you notice that this is just another Call of Duty game with wall-running and Titans. To be fair, the visual fidelity is not changing at all. It\s the \story\ that takes place in some terribly dull environments like the really dark sewage system or the weird sci-fi factory (that makes you jump like it\s a new Mario with guns).I bought the game after reading how amazing it is in the reviews. It\s cool but not that great.Let me point out the main problems in this game for me:1. Wall-running and jumping is unpredictable. You\ll die many times because the system is unpredictable. The good thing here is that after every \parkour death\ you will restart quickly just were you died2. Guns are so confusing. This is a Call of Duty problem because it doesn\t work in the sci-fi setting. While we love to have the real names of all guns and many of us know the brands and models from movies or thug\s life (wink), it is pointless to name the fake guns using codes and numbers (for example something like RC270) in a game that has so many weapons. Easy solution? Less weapons that are almost the same and more characteristic names (funnily enough some of those weapons do just that, like the Mastiff-something riffle).3. The levels are boring in my opinion, and the shooting scenarios are chaotic and easily forgettable.4. Titans are no mechs. They\re more like exosuits. I love mech games and this does not feel right. It\s cool, but it lacks the feeling of being in a powerful machine with amazing defense and slightly less mobility. The CoD Killstreak rewards seem much more powerful to me.Now the good things about this game:1. It\s solid. The framerate seems perfect, visuals are never below technically great (even if on the boring side most of the campaign). When it works it can be spectacular.2. Titan entering animation is fantastic.3. Some story elements are interesting but they are very rare (like the time travel mechanic).4. Gameplay is just like any other Call of Duty game so if you like that, it\s great for you.5. Story is a bit less stupid than usually but the storytelling itself is **** It goes like this: \Go here. Oh! We barely made it! Yaaaay!!! Now let\s do this again and again and, OH! Wait! Let\s do another poorly disguised fetch quest cause we\re here anyway.  OK guys,  this is really the last one, you guys! HA! just kidding. OK now we\re really done. You did it! Great job\.Disclaimer:1. Any game that has a single player campaign can be judged by it. 70 Euros is a lot of money so I feel entitled to feel disappointment when what I receive isn\t exceptional. Excuses like \oh it\s a multiplayer game\ are the reason we are getting ****ty campaigns like this one (or worse) so often these days.2. The review is not very in-depth, because I don\t like this game enough to waste more time on it.\

Biggest surprise of the year? Maybe. Great campaign with some bonkers original levels that have never been done before. Multiplayer is good but being a BF fan I prefer huge maps with lots of people playing. It's good though

I was let down. The core gameplay was good no doubt but the lack of singleplayer and certain multiplayer nuances just didn't feel good to me. It quickly fell out of my "play regular" category and just went by the wayside without ever giving it a second thought other than when talking about games that "could have been." With that said, titanfall 2 delivered on every mark it missed in the first game. The gameplay is somehow better and more fluid. The multiplayer subtleness and nuances are spot on. The single player is actually really good and flows well with the game. Its just fun, and after all that is what games are supposed to be. This group captured lightning in a bottle with COD 4 and I dare say they did it again. Buy it, its well worth it.\

BUY THIS GAME!!!I love this game, it sticks out as definitely the best shooter of the year, but also the last few year. A little background on me: I am a huge FPS fan, and have put hundreds of hours into games like Call of Duty, Battlefield, CSGO, and many more. I did not like the first Titanfall, and My expectations were low with this game, especially for the single-player.ThisBUY THIS GAME!!!I love this game, it sticks out as definitely the best shooter of the year, but also the last few year. A little background on me: I am a huge FPS fan, and have put hundreds of hours into games like Call of Duty, Battlefield, CSGO, and many more. I did not like the first Titanfall, and My expectations were low with this game, especially for the single-player.This game blows anything from the past while straight out of the water. The campaign is fun as hell and trying not to spoil anything, BT can be very comical in his perception of the world around him. Multi-player is fresh and new; something that Call of Duty has tried to do for the past three years, and failed. They definitely listened to the criticisms of the first game, of which the were many. The main GM is Attrition, basically TDM. It's fast paced, balls to the walls action. to quotes Rags, "A still pilot is often a dead pilot, and that's something I enjoy. It can be a little overwhelming, but these complaints pale in comparison to the positives.This game has been completely underappreciated by a market of FPS fans who claim to want innovation and fresh game play, but continue to buy Call of Duty every year. This game was screwed over by EA and it really should have came out in early 2017, when people are looking for a new shooter to blow off the steam of Call of Duty and Battlefield.My complaints are minor, and most of them are my fault or can be solved by me. First the game will not start on true dual core CPUs. I had to install a separate program to fix this. I know the minimum specs recommend a quad core, but my Pentium G3258 is handling the game just fine, usually between 60-80 FPS in multi-player. This game literally runs better than CSGO on my computer. Second, I am getting a weird crunching sound out of my microphones which makes the game impossible to hear and unplayable if your trying to listen, this doesn't affect me too much as I usually listen to podcasts while playing games. Lastly, I don't know what is causing this but, every other game or so in the lobby I am kicked from multi-player and sent back to the main menu. It's no big deal as all I have to do is rejoin multi-player, which is surprisingly quick.Overall a bad-ass game, and totally worth your time and money.\

Titanfall 2 is a good sci-fi game that delivers a interesting story and solid multiplayer that will for sure please many Titanfall fans and even newcomers alike. The story takes the world-building of games like Half-Life 2 and tries to mix with mech combat that can feel cool at times to do. Unfortunately, the main character is completely forgettable and generic and while I appreciate theTitanfall 2 is a good sci-fi game that delivers a interesting story and solid multiplayer that will for sure please many Titanfall fans and even newcomers alike. The story takes the world-building of games like Half-Life 2 and tries to mix with mech combat that can feel cool at times to do. Unfortunately, the main character is completely forgettable and generic and while I appreciate the mech having a voice and offering some banter, he just doesn't sell me his entire idea. He's no DOG from HL2, but to be fair he can be a battle station for you to pilot. The bosses are just different types of Titans that serve as tutorials for the multiplayer and I'm not convinced they are clever or interesting. The world building is good and all, but where is the Ravenholms? Where is the long runs down empty highways and tunnels that offer more than just (admittedly) fun platforming that gauges exploration and rewards the player? I see alot of potential in Titanfall 2's story, but it needs more to make a stronger statement to me.The multiplayer is equally good but troubling. The good parts is the combat and fluidity of movement is really awesome, allowing you to take down pilot and titan alike in a range of versatility. The inclusion of free dlc and class setup is a nice touch, but my problems lie also in the fact the game modes are lacking and because of the way the game was sold at launch, the servers are essentially dead and laid bare. Finding a game is difficult and I feel that it doesn't deserve this because it is a good game that deserves better.\

This game is easily the best shooter on the market. The fluid and fast paced movement is amazing. The gun play is diverse. The multiplayer is where its at but single player is a true gem and does an exceptional job at creating a well paced world and created a bond between Man and Machine.

To Summarize, I believe Titanfall 2 to be a superior successor to the original in almost every way.  Some things are different that may make some people feel it wasn't broke so why fix it - but in terms of keeping me excited to be playing for the long haul, I think Respawn nailed it!I found the original Titans to be so modular I quickly settled on a "best loadout" for me, Strider withTo Summarize, I believe Titanfall 2 to be a superior successor to the original in almost every way.  Some things are different that may make some people feel it wasn't broke so why fix it - but in terms of keeping me excited to be playing for the long haul, I think Respawn nailed it!I found the original Titans to be so modular I quickly settled on a "best loadout" for me, Strider with 40mm burst fire, cluster bombs, and particle shield wall. No matter the map this never changed, the other Titan options were wasted on me. With TF2 each Titan seems to have a roll, so I pick my Titan based on map and enemy Titan types. I default to Tone most often I find, likely due to its similarity to my original, but I almost just as often switch things around depending on the match.The pilots are nicely varied. I find the grapple and phase powers to both be very rewarding to the imaginative pilot, and feel none of the powers are throw away. For guns, I can find at least one in each class I feel intuitive with, and while I'm not a big CoD player I feel the weapon selection is ample (but if you do play BF or CoD you might disagree).My problems with the game steer more to the game types. Attrition appears to be the only mode I can consistently have fun with. Mixing with Adds while hunting pilots and facing off against Titans is a blast. The different Specters and larger Reapers are a great addition. Most other modes don't offer enough Titan time - they end up being just pilots vs pilots for most of the match. And Last Titan Standing, I went in with a team of 4 friends but somehow we can't win a single game. Legions appear to be biased for this game type. However these are the kinds of things I can see Respawn fixing after some feedback and balancing so it's a minor concern for the short term.Originally I hated the lack of shields and the addition of batteries in the tech test. It didn't make sense and my Titans would die really quick. But with the full game I find there is a very enjoyable ballet between engaging or surviving, coordinating with other Titans or attacking solo. Playing with a friend often times means teaming up, one in Titan, the other harassing enemy Titans, stealing batteries, and keeping my partner at peak efficiency. It is a much more complicated play style that I expect will keep me from getting board of the more basic strategy of the original for much longer.  A few times I try to maximize Titan longevity at the cost of points and find it easy possible to spend the entire match in a single Titan.  Sure you won't be on the front lines racking up all the kills but give me a Tone and a map that isn't valley warfare and I can stay pretty safe if that's what I want to do.I really hope more people pick up a copy by Christmas. It's a really great game that I think will only get better from a larger pool of pilots. And all future maps and DLC included? $60 was a very simple decision for me to make. No regrets!\

simply put, this game is incredible.  the campaign is excellent, but the multiplayer is even better. you can tell this game was developed by Respawn Entertainment, the developers who were formerly part of Infinity Ward. why? because this game is so darn polished. these guys created the COD franchise, and developed both COD Modern Warfare and Modern Warfare 2,  so their credentials aresimply put, this game is incredible.  the campaign is excellent, but the multiplayer is even better. you can tell this game was developed by Respawn Entertainment, the developers who were formerly part of Infinity Ward. why? because this game is so darn polished. these guys created the COD franchise, and developed both COD Modern Warfare and Modern Warfare 2,  so their credentials are without question. oh yeah, back to the game lol.  the graphics are very good, the gameplay and controls are super tight, and action is fast, intense, and nonstop.  i truly believe this very well may be my favorite FPS shooter ever. and dont believe the very few low user scores on this site. most of them are either bitter Titanfall 1 fans, who didnt want any evolution of the franchise, or they are COD fans,  who are just highly upset that Titanfall 2 will be  "infinitely" better than COD infinite warfare upon its release.  believe me when i tell you, this game is of the highest quality, and shooters rarely, if ever, get any better or more polished than this.  it is without question the smoothest playing FPS i have ever played.  but really, i cant put into words how silky smooth it plays. you have to play it for yourself and you will see what i mean.\

This is hands down the best first person shooter for PS4. I was a dedicated Destiny player for 2 years, I bought and enjoy Battlefield 1, but if you only buy one FPS for the PS4, buy Titanfall 2, it's in a league of it's own. The gameplay mechanics are what set it apart and how a game feels is in my view the most important aspect of a shooter. The game has been compared to COD but I thinkThis is hands down the best first person shooter for PS4. I was a dedicated Destiny player for 2 years, I bought and enjoy Battlefield 1, but if you only buy one FPS for the PS4, buy Titanfall 2, it's in a league of it's own. The gameplay mechanics are what set it apart and how a game feels is in my view the most important aspect of a shooter. The game has been compared to COD but I think that's a mistake, it really feels and plays nothing like it. To me it has more in common with Quake (super fast smooth arena shooter) with Titans adding the element of the old Armored Core games. Respawn may not have spent nearly as much as their competitors advertising this game, but rest assured that those saving were invested where it counts- in making the game. With the exception of MGSV (huge Kojima fan here) this is in my view the best game for the PS4. Buy it.\

This may seem like your standard twitch shooter at first, but if you put in the time to learn the movement mechanics you'll how much depth there is to this game. The multiplayer maps were built with both titans and pilots in mind. The maps have the right amount of space and layout for the Titans to fight, but are still able to keep the fast paced player vs. player combat from the firstThis may seem like your standard twitch shooter at first, but if you put in the time to learn the movement mechanics you'll how much depth there is to this game. The multiplayer maps were built with both titans and pilots in mind. The maps have the right amount of space and layout for the Titans to fight, but are still able to keep the fast paced player vs. player combat from the first game. While the campaign is short, it still offers a great gameplay experience, like bosses and puzzles that you wouldn't normally find in a FPS. The game is not perfect and has changed some things for better or worse, but it still retains the fast and incredible smooth gamplay from the first TitanFall.P.S. I've read some of the negative user reviews, and from what I can see those people only put in the minimum amount time possible (Or have not even played the game). Like I typed earlier it may appear like like another generic shoot, but the movement and combat is alone makes the game fun and full of replay value.\

Everything I loved about the first game is back and it's better. The constant tug of war between battling giant titans, taking out incredibly mobile and impactful pilots, and farming Titanfall's unique NPCs all in one match leaves you with an incredible feeling of accomplishment. The single player mode is a welcome addition akin to a buddy cop movie between you and a giant robot, which isEverything I loved about the first game is back and it's better. The constant tug of war between battling giant titans, taking out incredibly mobile and impactful pilots, and farming Titanfall's unique NPCs all in one match leaves you with an incredible feeling of accomplishment. The single player mode is a welcome addition akin to a buddy cop movie between you and a giant robot, which is a story that you may not have known that you needed.\

This game is absolutely amazing.Starting with the campaign, the writers picked a great angle to take - rifleman looking to make "pilot", the rank needed to get paired with a titan and become the ultimate fighting force on the battlefield.  The only problem is it's not easy to do, especially when you're in the middle of full-scale interplanetary war.  Nonetheless, you get your chance,This game is absolutely amazing.Starting with the campaign, the writers picked a great angle to take - rifleman looking to make "pilot", the rank needed to get paired with a titan and become the ultimate fighting force on the battlefield.  The only problem is it's not easy to do, especially when you're in the middle of full-scale interplanetary war.  Nonetheless, you get your chance, albeit rather quickly which is kind of a shame .. they could have played out the training/desire factor a bit more, but still tons of fun nonetheless.  Throughout the campaign you learn how to become a tier 1 pilot, picking up new and interesting titan loadouts along the way (weapons packages that give you different advantages against bosses).  Oh yea, there's bosses.  As an older gamer, I miss bosses being the checkpoint between levels.  This game's got them and they're definitely challenging.  The campaign is about 6 hours of play (didn't time it so forgive me) but by the end you start to love your titan and you save each other form crazy situations.  The final scene is one of hope that sets up a likely sequel (YES!). They did an amazing job of playing with emotions and weaving a great story amongst a chaotic universe.Multiplayer is just tons of fun.  There were critics saying you didn't get Titans quick enough during the tech test ... well you get them plenty fast now, so don't listen to that nonsense.  Leveling is no quick feat, so prepare to spend some serious time just getting the next best gun.  Customization is on point, tons of different ways to play  The addition of the pilot tactical (like grapple or sonar knife) make the game tons of fun to play.  You can really move around the map just like in the first one, except now you're doing it FASTER.Get this game ... you really won't regret it.\

Titanfall 2 improves on many aspects of Titanfall 1, and while there are a few design choices that take some time getting used to, the game feels like a complete package.  The campaign tells an interesting and meaningful story in a compressed amount of time, which is perfect for most FPS players.  The multiplayer is tons of fun, and as you become more familiar with the maps you get a senseTitanfall 2 improves on many aspects of Titanfall 1, and while there are a few design choices that take some time getting used to, the game feels like a complete package.  The campaign tells an interesting and meaningful story in a compressed amount of time, which is perfect for most FPS players.  The multiplayer is tons of fun, and as you become more familiar with the maps you get a sense of the wallrunning and mobility lanes that you can use to creatively come at your opponents from unpredictable angles.The gunplay feels solid, the class based Titans give interesting choices and create dynamic fights between titan classes as they have strengths you want to avoid and weaknesses you want to exploit, for example Tone is great against Ronin at range because of it's 40mm autocannon and rocket salvos, and Ronins weapons and core ability are all short-medium range, if the Tone pilot allows Ronin to close the gap, Ronin can output a ton of damage in a short amount of time.The sendoff of burn cards in favor of boosts is a welcome change, although some boosts seem very strong and some boosts seem very weak.  I can see boosts as being a thing that are banned from competitive play because essentially when every player is taking the same boost, it would be the same as no players having boosts, but with more "unfun" moments when a titan instakills you with SMGs using amped weapons.Overall, Titanfall 2 is a complete package, all DLC, maps and weapons are coming free, the single player, while short, is meaningful and has fun sequences as you and BT fight against all odds.  The multiplayer is a blast, and feels like a mixture of Tribes and Mechassault, it's both fast and the gunplay feels tight.\

A hidden gem ! Multiplayer is pure fun and you can tell where all the talent from Infinity Ward went, it mops the floor with all the Call of Duty titles from the past 6 years ! Campaign is okay but I recommend playing it on highest difficulty if you wan't some challenge, otherwise it might feel a little short . Can't wait to see what free dlc will be provided post launch.

Now to give that game its proper due, the graphics and atmosphere are both fantastic, and multiplayer is massive to say the least.  That said, I couldn't get into it for some reason - and didn't feel like I was having that much fun playing it.With that, I went ahead and did a straight swap for Titanfall 2, even though I didn't have high expectations for it. Long story short, I haven't regretted that decision one bit, as TF2 is possibly the best console fps games I've played. The movement, speed, and gun fights remind me a little bit of Quake 3 Arena - which was absolutely frantic and tons of fun (from my PC gaming days and the old mouse and keyboard combo).If you're still wondering which game to pick up, this'll hit the right spot if you're looking for something fast paced and fun. Highly recommended.\

The multiplayer has fast, smooth, and responsive gameplay. The lag is minimal and the hit detection is solid. If you're looking for a fast shooter like CoD, without all the OP specialists, broken lag comp, and clustered maps with corners everywhere that randomize the gameplay, TF2 has you covered. Some maps are a tad on the big side, but they cater well to all forms of engagement withThe multiplayer has fast, smooth, and responsive gameplay. The lag is minimal and the hit detection is solid. If you're looking for a fast shooter like CoD, without all the OP specialists, broken lag comp, and clustered maps with corners everywhere that randomize the gameplay, TF2 has you covered. Some maps are a tad on the big side, but they cater well to all forms of engagement with builidings and tighter areas in the middle of the map. I've been running mostly smg classes and they work splendidly.There is a lot of customization unlike in TF1 with perks, boosts, attachments, camos, player cards etc. More guns would be nice, as there are currently only around 20 for pilots, but maybe they'll be added in later in addition to the free maps and dlc that's coming.The movement system is smooth and allows you to move faster by chaining slides and wallruns together. BO3 feels clunky in comparison. On top of choosing a number from 1 to 8 for your sensitivity, there are several different response curves you can choose from to tailor your aim and turning abilities.Overall it's a solid game and is super fun to play. I've been looking for a fast, fluid, and fun shooter. Titanfall 2 looks like it's gonna be it!\

From Beginning to end Uncharted 4: A thief's end never seizes to impress, as a fan of the series I can surely say that this is the perfect conclusion the fans were looking for, this time not only being overcome and amazed by the intense action of previous titles but actually feeling like an explorer as the game breaks through set pieces where the action slows down and you're left toFrom Beginning to end Uncharted 4: A thief's end never seizes to impress, as a fan of the series I can surely say that this is the perfect conclusion the fans were looking for, this time not only being overcome and amazed by the intense action of previous titles but actually feeling like an explorer as the game breaks through set pieces where the action slows down and you're left to explore uncharted 4's rich, beautiful environments from the perfect grass textures, nothing short of realistic lighting effects, all the way down to the audio used for every surface Nate steps on presented in masterful 1080p graphics utilising the playstation 4's maximum. There is no doubt in mind that naughty dog spent ages perfecting this game to make it the masterpiece that it is today. The story itself feels like naughty dog took a pace in the direction of how the last of us was made and that is certainly a good thing. The game not only has numerous treasures and letters for you to collect but also many interactive pieces to remind us of the previous titles sparking major nostalgia in me as many of the fans also probably felt. Without spoiling anything I can say the story is phenomenal from beginning to end, through the 14 hours it took me to finish the game on moderate difficulty I can say I did not come out disappointed but couldn't help feeling the want for more, maybe...uncharted 5....I can dream!The multiplayer is very fast paced and addictive, the weapons are vast and there's many different choices you can make whether you prefer a hand on combat approach or you're more of a sneaky sniper.New Perks and mysticals are also a welcome addition as they give players an extra edge in the field.All I can say is that I will be playing the multiplayer for months to come and will shortly be returning to the story to enjoy the lure of the story a second time as well as collect my platinum.Naughty Dog you did it again, you created a MASTERPIECE.10/10 without a doubt in my mind,Enjoy the ride and if you haven't picked it up yet, then what are you waiting for!?\

This game is even better than I imagined. I had very high expectations for this game, considering that I've been a big fan of each game on the PS3, and heck, even the game on the PSVITA. And yet, this game blew my expectations out of the water. From a technical standpoint, this game is a modern marvel. The graphics are amazing and almost lifelike. Things like hair, foliage, lighting,This game is even better than I imagined. I had very high expectations for this game, considering that I've been a big fan of each game on the PS3, and heck, even the game on the PSVITA. And yet, this game blew my expectations out of the water. From a technical standpoint, this game is a modern marvel. The graphics are amazing and almost lifelike. Things like hair, foliage, lighting, shadows, and even more and done extremely well. This game is the embodiment of the term "next-gen" and it is, without a doubt, the best looking game on this console generation. The gameplay is everything that you would expect from an Uncharted game, plus more! Now, a lot of people are complaining about how the game is just like any of it's predecessor's gameplay wise, and honestly, it is, but that's not a bad thing. This game is Uncharted, it's not some new IP, and so of course it's going to be like the older games, but there's so much more new stuff added to keep it refreshing. Things such as the hook mechanic, the sliding mechanic, the new stealth system, and more. The AI is also better than ever. In older Uncharted games, when you got spotted, the AI wouldn't stop unless you were dead or they were dead. Once they saw you, they basically fixated on you, even if you were out of their sight. In this game, the AI is much different than that. There's three different "modes" of the AI: passive, neutral, and aggressive. Passive shows up above an enemy when you're out in the open and there's a great chance of them spotting you. Neutral is when they think they've spotted you, but you've obstructed their visual with you and then they go and investigate. And aggressive is when they start shooting at you after spotting you. This adds a much more realistic taste to the game that is done very well. The shooting is as fun as ever as well. They've also added another new mechanic...vehicles. Now, in the game, you can drive cars and boats, which, while it may not seem groundbreaking, is just a nice touch. The game also borrowed a bunch of things from The Last of Us, a game also developed by Naughty Dog in 2013. Things such as the side conversations, and the new hidden things such as documents that you can discover, look at and read. Again, while it may not seem groundbreaking, it's a nice touch. Another cool thing is that, when Nate, Sam, and Sully are having a conversation, if you do anything to stop the conversation (i.e. driving through a waterfall or a shootout) they'll say something like, "wait, what were we talking about" and they'll just pick up the conversation from there. It's that realistic, and the detail is perfect. And the story, oh, the story. It's marvelous! The end of Uncharted 3 kind of left you for a yearning to find out what happened after the seemingly abrupt ending. Well, I don't want to spoil anything, but let's just say, it's great to find out what happened, and the story is anything that you would expect from Uncharted, but even better. It's so much more fleshed out. Anyways, whether you're a big fan of the series, whether this is your first game, or whether you don't even have a PS4, you NEED to pick up this game. The $60 price tag is way worth it in the long run (though, I would recommend playing the first 3 games just so you know most of the characters and what's going on). It's that good. I'm about halfway through the game and I'm loving it. I haven't played much multiplayer (though I did participate in the open-beta) and let's just say that it's not tacked on and is very much fun... : )\
game changer for xbox owners which have been sadly left behind , halo and gears of wars franchises have become baby games over night compared to this !!!!!!1

And felt it sud be defined as a "Painting in Motion"...I'm not doing any review fr this masterpiece, rather sharing my POV about it..First of all I felt the long wait for Uncharted 4 was of worth as Naughty Dog didnot rush and made anyEvery good thing comes to an end, so as the epic Uncharted 4...Finished the legendary title, which is going to b d undisputed GOTY 2016, few mins ago... And felt it sud be defined as a "Painting in Motion"...I'm not doing any review fr this masterpiece, rather sharing my POV about it..First of all I felt the long wait for Uncharted 4 was of worth as Naughty Dog didnot rush and made any compromise at all with the last installment in d UC series...Superb visuals with occasional framerate drop issues (I didn't download the day 1's 5GB patch as I lacked patience), an eye fr minute details, seamless integration from cutscene to gameplay, picturesque locations n places with interactive features with the player were the real pleasure for eyes... also the art of storytelling thru a vdo game got redefined. Compared to the previous UC installments, it has got way better enemy AI, and in many a cases bunch of enemies outnumbering the player, though aerial knockouts were bit of a challenge to me (it was really disappointing at times) in the game as it was showcased in the gameplay reveals, drivable cars with its natural interaction with muddy and rock solid surfaces, hardcore action sequences (both hand to hand and shooting), great amount of stealth, multiple paths to reach or execute the opponents, trickier puzzles (some were really nightmares), also the map wider than the semi open world maps...characters (known and newly introduced) are nicely knitted, revealing their hidden secrets, humane sides and twisted edges along with the pace of the story...3 yrs ago wen TLOU came from the same dev house, we were mesmerized n became speechless... Now I can vouch that UC4 in addition to that will hypnotize u all as well...Won't say much now...enjoy this masterpiece asap, which pushed the PS4 boundaries to the optimum level and delivered the wildest and wonderful dreams in a small round shaped blue ray disc..And for Naughty Gods...Thnks for making UC4 nd introducing it to mankind...plss take max time for TLOU 2 and make us awestruck with ur creations in future again n again..\

Uncharted is one of those series that comes around once in awhile and revolutionize the industry, and with Naughty Dog's latest and last game, they have done it again. I have been a fan of the Uncharted series for years now, but I will not let this affect my review. This game is simply amazing and in my opinion, it\s the best game on the PlayStation 4 by far. Maybe even the best game onUncharted is one of those series that comes around once in awhile and revolutionize the industry, and with Naughty Dog's latest and last game, they have done it again. I have been a fan of the Uncharted series for years now, but I will not let this affect my review. This game is simply amazing and in my opinion, it\s the best game on the PlayStation 4 by far. Maybe even the best game on any modern console. The motion capture is the best I have seen in any game, it feels like real people having real conversations, who is being brought to life by Nolan North and his fellow actor friends. The game play is, to put it simply, fun. From shooting enemies with a range of different weapons to swinging from ledge to ledge with a rope, the game is never a bore. Naughty Dog has also in it's latest release shown us just what the console are capable of and has raised the bar for future video games to come. The story is, without spoiling it, amazing, it's never boring, the new characters are great and it moves on with a good pace.\

I haven't played through all the games yet, but for a couple of hours playing I already make sure that this could be the best Uncharted game ever made. This doesn't mean that all those cinematic cutscences and intensive action movie plots have certainly excelled the previous epsoides,which may be extremely hard to beat. I am talking about the impressive storytelling and beautiful pacing,I haven't played through all the games yet, but for a couple of hours playing I already make sure that this could be the best Uncharted game ever made. This doesn't mean that all those cinematic cutscences and intensive action movie plots have certainly excelled the previous epsoides,which may be extremely hard to beat. I am talking about the impressive storytelling and beautiful pacing, which holds your heart and always make you want to dig further to unveil the whole stroy,this is precious feeling I experienced only in a handful of video games like The last of us.The feeling of shooting is much better than before,weighted and balanced to a perect level, the explosive effect is unprecedented, and the new laso adds much fun to the platform jumping and climing part.This is certainly not a perfect game, at least not perfect for everyone, for you can be deeply attracted by the story and characters and couldn't  have enough of it, or just feel boring for too much talking and emotional expressions. If you just want to grab some big gun and kill your way out,this may not be the right game for you,but if you want to explore the intriguing life of a real treasure hunter, I cannot find anything parallel to this one. So it's a certain 10/10,for me.\

Simply put, the best game on PS4 and one of the best games I've ever played - period. The gunplay, which is the bread and butter of the game, feels great. The guns have recoil and handle like a cannon, not a pea-shooter like in previousSimply put, the best game on PS4 and one of the best games I've ever played - period. Visually eye-boggling with crazy-refined mechanics, you actually feel like you're free climbing not just jumping around the side of a mountain cliff. The gunplay, which is the bread and butter of the game, feels great. The guns have recoil and handle like a cannon, not a pea-shooter like in previous entries. You can definitely see the influence from The Last of Us in the gameplay and the grounded story.This is definitely the culmination of 10 years worth of work. You would be doing yourself a disservice if you own a PS4 and didn't at least try this game.Yes, I've always been a fan of the series and it's modern-day Indiana Jones vibe, but this is an outstanding game, Uncharted or not. I had high expectations for this game, but my expectations were blown out of the water nonetheless. I had a smile on my face from start to finish.\

Great game, doesn't deserve the low rating from users. The parkour elements are superb as always, dialogue is excellent and hilarious at times and I'm really liking the story so far. The multiplayer is fun and plays a bit like The Last Of Us factions, only a lot more fast paced and less stealthy. I only wish you could create your own character in MP.

Absolutely awesome.  If you like action/adventure/3rd person shooters, a must buy game!  Game plays like a much refined version of the previous games.  Feels like tombraider at times with the shooting mechanics of a gears of war.  Story is exceptional and presentation better than anything else this gen.  Something to note is also the sound design, with plenty of options to play about withAbsolutely awesome.  If you like action/adventure/3rd person shooters, a must buy game!
